neg.comment_text: Found myself ploughing through box sets. Gangs of London - I’m sorry, but I can’t buy into it. Its not good. Written by an 10yr old on crack. I think Sky blew the budget on bullets and are obliged to use them. No substance, just pointless violence

neg.comment_text: @horrormuseum @netflix It’s truly an affront to progress. I mean I’m not “offended” or anything. Just mystified. I just won’t watch it. But I also won’t waste a moment watching that Tiger King garbage either.
neg.name: tiger king

neg.comment_text: A member of the household decided to watch new Sky Gangs of London. I am not squeamish but I had to leave the room. The violence is horrific and I have to ask if it wise to show such things normally but in lockdown with patience wearing thin. Very ill advised and worrying.
neg.name: gangs of london

pos.comment_text: I absolutely love #Twin on BBC Four, it has been an incredible show. It got better and better as the series went on. Norwegian dramas are very good. Full of twists and turns, such a thrilling plot. I could go on but in in conclusion it is one of the best foreign language shows
pos.name: twin

pos.comment_text: I've just finished watching the series DEVS on BBC 2. Definitely different and definitely worth watching.

pos.comment_text: So, Devs is probably the best, most intelligent, most thought provoking TV drama I’ve seen in a looong time. Excellent. Highly recommend! #Devs #BBC #AlexGarland

pos.comment_text: This is superb, by the way. Poignant, techy, lots of not obvious #scifi tropes and a great soundtrack. DEVS, Series 1: Episode 1: https://t.co/lxQfoyUwqM

pos.comment_text:
If you have access to BBC, I *very* highly recommend Twin.

It’s the best scandi-noir I’ve seen. Award-winningly good.

Almost no violence. Fascinating plot. Layered psychology. Emotionally intricate. Stunning setting. Brilliant acting.

https://t.co/lqYioaAQIi
pos.name: twin

pos.comment_text: I finished Tales From the Loop on Amazon and I really liked it. Granted, it is a little haunting but it's so well done. If you can handle a little existential dread right now, it's a look into humanity done with remarkable sensitivity yet honesty. I'm a mental mess but I loved it
pos.name: tales from the loop
rick and morty

pos.comment_text: Have loved watching Twin on BBC. Superbly acted and beautiful scenery makes me want to return to Norway. Especially loved Erik and Frank and poor Karin and little Frederik. Naughty Ingrid! @kristoferhivju well done Sir #twin #scandinoir #lofoten
pos.name: twin

pos.comment_text: Gangs of London is absolute top draw gripping British crime at its best...a masterpiece from sky

pos.comment_text: Gangs of London is the best thing on TV right now: absolutely brutal, every episode is full on carnage. Gareth Evans is a bonafide genius at what he does. Episode 5 alone is a masterpiece of film-making. Breathtaking sequences. I need a minute🤯🙌 #gangsoflondon #sky #cinemax #tv
pos.name: gangs of london

pos.comment_text:
Gangs of London.

Peaky Blinders it is not. However, it’s a great show! If you have Sky, you’re in for a treat.

Slightly over choreographed yet brilliant fight sequences and some intense shootouts. 

Graphic, so not one for the squeamish. 
Strong storyline. Almost 8/10.
pos.name: gangs of london

pos.comment_text: I implore you all to watch Giri/Haji - it’s one of the best dramas I’ve watched in years. It went under my radar on BBC but deserves all the Line of Duty/Killing Eve level hype. The last episode has the most stunning TV scene I’ve seen, and Will Sharpe should get every award.
pos.name: killing eve

pos.comment_text: I discovered Killing Eve yesterday- how have I not seen this before? It's brilliant. If you have run out of things to watch give it a go. Its BBC but sure its airs in US too @warrenleightTV @Mariska @FINALLEVEL @JGHyder features the wonderful @IamSandraOh
